changes.env: “in certain contexts, notably in the nunation”

notes: “assimilation in some of the longer vowels”

change_sets.src: from Borg, Alexander (1985), Cypriot Arabic

notes: NB: Changes may not be in chronological order.
{θ,ð} {f,v} {x,ɣ} voicing neutralized “in contact with other fricatives”
Epenthesis in medial CCC clusters, often so that the syllable break is between the second and third consonants

change_sets.src: from Brustad, Kristen, Mahmoud Al-Batal, and Abbas Al-Tonsi (2010), Alif Baa: Introduction to Letters and Sounds, 3rd. Ed.; http:

notes: Resyllabification across word boundaries to prevent vowel-initial syllablesr gains emphatic status except when next to i, and even then it’s becoming more common in that environment

changes.env: if ɑ(ː) is elsewhere in the word
else (sometimes it seems more like ɛ(ː) to me)
except in several words, two of which are al-Qâhira and musîqâ

notes: Two consecutive consonants assimilate to the voicing of the second (obstruents only?)

notes: Epenthesis (it seems i is preferred) breaking up final consonant clusters
